page.title: 07The Brewery at Horsebridge
page.content: In 1480, a nunnery was converted in to a{public house}called{The Black {Horse.}This later changed to The Pack Horse Inn until the Civil War. Then King Charles 1st visited the inn and his seal remains in the front porch. Since that time, it has been called {The Royal.}Locals, holiday-makers and passers-by use the pub which{brews its {own beer, the ingredients}coming in the main,{from Ashburton,}Devon.{35 {gallons}are brewed at a time and the length of the fermentation process depends on the strength of the brew, {approximately 4 days.}The brews are known as the{Tamar, the Horsebridge {Best}and the{Heller.}The prices are competitive with other name brands. An extension of the brewery is planned for the future.
